title: Zapu to ‘recall’  Zanu PF ministers
description: BY NIZBERT MOYO Opposition party Zapu says it will this week write to Parliament seeking to recall its former members, who are now part of the ruling Zanu PF. Iphuthile Maphosa, the Zapu spokesperson, said the decision was taken at a special meeting of the party’s National People’s Council held in Bulawayo yesterday. Former Zapu […]

title: Zapu to ‘recall’  Zanu PF ministers
description: BY NIZBERT MOYO Opposition party Zapu says it will this week write to Parliament seeking to recall its former members, who are now part of the ruling Zanu PF. Iphuthile Maphosa, the Zapu spokesperson, said the decision was taken at a special meeting of the party’s National People’s Council held in Bulawayo yesterday. Former Zapu […]

title: Khupe gets millions from govt purse
description: The government on Friday gave MDC-T leader Thokozani Khupe $7,4 million, insisting that she is the legitimate leader of the main opposition in Parliament despite ongoing court disputes about her status, it has emerged.

title: Govt blames Gukurahundi victims documentation delays on Covid-19
description: The documentation of victims of Gukurahundi has been affected by the current lockdown measures implemented to stop the spread of Covid-19, Home Affairs and Cultural Heritage minister Kazembe Kazembe has said.

title: Chamisa speaks on ‘next steps’
description: MDC Alliance leader Nelson Chamisa will today speak on the direction his party will take in the wake of a fierce battle for control of the country’s main opposition party.

title: Mnangagwa wants to kill me: Moyo
description: Exiled former Higher Education minister Jonathan Moyo claims President Emmerson Mnangagwa tried to assassinate him and he has evidence to prove it.

title: Biti, Karenyi – More freed on bail
description: MDC Alliance vice presidents, Tendai Biti and Lynnette Karenyi-Kore and other party leaders who were arrested at the Morgan Tsvangirai House on Friday have been granted $1000 bail each.

title: I’m living in fear of SB Moyo, Mutsvangwa, says Energy Mutodi
description: The tiff between President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s ministers sparked by Tanzania’s response to the coronavirus outbreak escalated on Wednesday with Information deputy minister Energy Mutodi saying he is now living in fear of Foreign Affairs minister Sibusiso Moyo.

title: The recall of MDC-A MPs: Trial balloon or whistle-stopping acts?
description: The Supreme Court’s MDC-T presidential legitimacy has brought to the fore issues on appointments of key figures to Parliament; Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Commission; and the MDC-T national executive.

title: Chamisa vows to fight back after legislators’ recall
description: MDC Alliance leader, Nelson Chamisa has vowed to fight back after his rivals recalled four of his legislators from Parliament on Tuesday, in a development that poses a threat to the future of Zimbabwe’s largest opposition party.

title: Chamisa’s Independence Day address in full: Fulfilling the democratic transformation promise
description: Happy Independence Day fellow Zimbabweans, wherever you are and whatever your political affiliation or station in life.

title: The cat is out of the bag for the United States’ Joe Biden
description: The International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination was celebrated in March.

title: Fisherman drowns
description: A fisherman drowned in a dam while another one was mauled by a crocodile while fishing in Madziva, Mt Darwin, last week.

title: Top MDC official recounts prison ‘hell’
description: A top MDC official, who was incarcerated together with 11 party youths in connection with protests in Chitungwiza last month, has described conditions under which they were held as hell.

title: Reprieve for death row prisoners
description: PRESIDENT Emmerson Mnangagwa has commuted death sentences to life imprisonment for all prisoners on death row for at least 10 years.

title: Covid-19: Chamisa preaches unity
description: MDC leader Nelson Chamisa believes the outbreak of the coronavirus gives Zimbabweans an opportunity to bury their differences as they fight the pandemic.

title: Chiwenga returns from China
description: VICE-President Constantino Chiwenga will not go into self-isolation after spending a fortnight in China and will instead lead the country’s battle to stop the spread of the coronavirus, a top government official said yesterday. BY MOSES MATENGA Chiwenga arrived back in the country on Friday night after President Emmerson Mnangagwa appointed him to lead a […]

title: Covid-19: Red flag over lockdown
description: The government yesterday moved to exempt certain sectors from the lockdown that begins tomorrow after industry warned that forcing all companies to shut down will ground the fragile economy.

title: Police, Zanu PF top human rights abusers
description: The Zimbabwe Republic Police and Zanu PF were the major perpetrators of human rights abuses during the month of December 2019, a report by the Zimbabwe Peace Project reveals. BY TAPIWA ZIVIRA In its Monthly Monitoring Report of December 2019, the pro-peace monitoring and documentation organisation states that police occupied 38% of perpetrators, up from […]

title: Why Zanu PF fears an uprising against Mnangagwa govt
description: Zimbabwe’s economic meltdown constitutes the biggest threat to Zanu PF’s continued hold on power, the ruling party has admitted.

title: Chamisa hits back at Chiwenga
description: MDC leader Nelson Chamisa yesterday  hit back at Vice-President Constantino Chiwenga, saying his party is not interested in sharing power with people that  stole elections.

title: Live Updates: 2020 National Budget
description: Subsidies and other Market Distortions Market distortions associated with subsidies present an additional risk to macroeconomic and fiscal stability. In particular, subsidies on fuel, electricity and agriculture have, in the past, led to large and often unpredictable expenses. Updates by Tinotenda Samukange, Ronald Magweta, Moses Matenga & Fidelity Mhlanga Where subsidies are deemed essential and […]

title: Kasukuwere  mourns Mugabe
description: Former Local Government minister Saviour Kasukuwere  yesterday said former President Robert Mugabe was a unique leader who did not bear grudges.

title: Tension grows as government clamps down on dissent
description: Teargas and truncheons returned to Zimbabwe’s cities in recent days, as protesters took to the streets to express their discontent at the deteriorating economy.

title: Mamombe bemoans violent politics
description: Harare West MP Joanah Mamombe says Zimbabwe’s politics is very violent in nature with women and the opposition being the biggest victims.
